decks.notes: The key concept of this UWx Control deck is to establish board control through a combination of counter spells, card draw, and removal spells. By utilizing cards like Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to manipulate their draws, the player can effectively control the opponent's plays. With powerful finishers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Entreat the Angels, the deck can close out games quickly once they have established dominance. Overall, the deck focuses on outlasting the opponent through control and resource management to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of countering spells, manipulating the top of the library, and wiping the board with cards like Terminus. It relies on synergy between Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to counter opponent's spells efficiently. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor to provide card advantage and control the game. The win condition is often through casting Entreat the Angels for a large number of Angel tokens or slowly grinding out the opponent with efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through card advantage and disruption, utilizing a combination of powerful control spells like Force of Will and Counterspell, along with card filtering cards like Ponder and Brainstorm. The key strategy revolves around setting up a lock with Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to control the opponent's spells, while using Terminus and Swords to Plowshares as removal. The win condition is to either control the game until Entreat the Angels can provide a finisher, or to generate card advantage with Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's resources through land denial and disruption while generating value through card advantage with Life from the Loam. The key strategy involves using Crop Rotation and Gamble to find key lands such as Dark Depths and The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale, while using cards like Wasteland and Ghost Quarter to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The deck utilizes control elements like Maze of Ith and Punishing Fire to maintain board control and pressure the opponent. The combination of land-based control and card advantage creates a powerful and resilient strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures and disruptive spells to apply pressure on the opponent while controlling the game's tempo. By combining powerful creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Gurmag Angler with disruptive spells like Lightning Bolt, Force of Will, and Daze, this deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and disrupt their game plan. Additionally, cards like Cabal Therapy and Deathrite Shaman provide additional disruption and graveyard interaction, further solidifying the deck's aggressive and controlling strategy.

The main focus of this Legacy Combo - Reanimator deck is to quickly get powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Sire of Insanity into the graveyard using cards like Faithless Looting, Entomb, and Thoughtseize, and then reanimate them onto the battlefield with cards like Exhume and Reanimate. The deck also includes disruption cards like Chancellor of the Annex and Collective Brutality to protect the combo. The deck utilizes fast mana sources like Dark Ritual, Lotus Petal, and Chrome Mox to power out its spells and can potentially win the game in just a few turns.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through its powerful spells and card manipulation. With a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw, the deck aims to stall the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition, usually through Jace, the Mind Sculptor or Entreat the Angels. The inclusion of Sensei's Divining Top, Counterbalance, and Predict allows for precise control over the top cards of the deck, further enhancing the control aspect of the deck. Overall, this deck aims to outmaneuver and outlast the opponent until it can secure a victory.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana and drawing cards with the synergy between Elves creatures and cards like Glimpse of Nature and Green Sun's Zenith. This allows the player to find key combo pieces like Craterhoof Behemoth or Natural Order to win the game. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Deathrite Shaman and Leovold to disrupt the opponent. The mana base is optimized for maximum efficiency, with cards like Gaea's Cradle providing extra mana for explosive turns. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and powerful Elf combo.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly get out powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn by using cards like Force of Will, Lotus Petal, and Sneak Attack. The key concept revolves around the combo of Show and Tell, which allows you to cheat these big creatures into play for a quick win. The deck also includes counterspells like Daze and Brainstorm to protect your combo. The goal is to overwhelm your opponent with these powerful creatures before they have a chance to respond.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying early pressure with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf. The deck utilizes disruptive spells like Force of Will and Hymn to Tourach to control the game and maintain tempo advantage. With mana denial from cards like Wasteland and Abrupt Decay to deal with problematic permanents, this deck aims to set a quick clock and disrupt opponents' plans to secure a fast victory in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on efficiently deploying threats like Delver of Secrets and Gurmag Angler while disrupting the opponent with cards like Daze, Force of Will, and Stifle. It also utilizes powerful removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Fatal Push to maintain board control. The deck's mana base consists of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to all colors of mana. True-Name Nemesis provides a difficult-to-answer threat, while Deathrite Shaman offers additional versatility and disruption. The deck aims to apply early pressure and prevent the opponent from establishing a strong board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly and efficiently through rituals and mana accelerants like Lion's Eye Diamond and Lotus Petal, in order to cast a high-impact spell like Tendrils of Agony or Ad Nauseam to win the game. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Cabal Therapy and Duress to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm help to dig for key pieces of the combo, while cards like Dark Petition and Infernal Tutor provide additional ways to find the win condition.

This Legacy deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Gurmag Angler, along with disruptive spells like Daze and Force of Will, to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan. The deck also includes card draw and selection spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to maintain card advantage and find key pieces. Wasteland is included to disrupt the opponent's mana base, while Cabal Therapy can help strip away key cards from their hand. The overall goal is to be proactive and aggressive while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly discard powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Sire of Insanity into the graveyard using cards like Careful Study, Thoughtseize, and Unmask, and then reanimate them onto the battlefield with cards like Exhume, Reanimate, and Animate Dead. By using fast mana like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal, as well as efficient tutors like Entomb, the deck aims to cheat out big threats early in the game and overwhelm the opponent with hard-to-answer creatures.

This UR Aggro deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a mix of cheap and efficient spells along with creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Delver of Secrets. The deck relies on aggressive play, utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning to clear the way for creatures to deal damage while also disrupting the opponent with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck's plan is to pressure the opponent early and finish them off before they can stabilize, focusing on tempo and aggression to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using burn spells and low-cost creatures with haste. By efficiently using spells like Lava Spike, Flame Rift, and Price of Progress, as well as the aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and finish the game quickly. The inclusion of cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Searing Blood adds additional pressure on the opponent while maintaining a fast-paced playstyle. Overall, this deck is designed to be aggressive and proactive in dealing damage.
